definition[0]: to use a particular amount of time for something, or give a particular share of money, space etc to someone or something
example[0]: Everyone who works for the company has been allotted ten shares.
example[1]: Try and allot two or three hours a day to revision.
example[2]: Each school will be allotted twenty seats.
definition[1]: to decide officially to give something to someone or to use something for a particular purpose
example[3]: Each employee was allotted 100 shares in the company.
